intro: Eriotheca gracilipes, commonly known as the slender-stemmed eriotheca, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its delicate, hairy stems and showy, five-petaled flowers that bloom in clusters. Its leaves are typically lance-shaped and covered in fine pubescence. Eriotheca gracilipes is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories and along stream banks.
